meanings.definition: To cause disorder or confusion in
meanings.sent1: The messy room will disorganize my thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise disorganize the peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: Trying to find my socks in that disorganized drawer is like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news disorganized her carefully laid plans.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind disorganized the neatly stacked papers into a chaotic whirlwind.

meanings.definition: To disrupt the orderly arrangement or functioning of
meanings.sent1: The construction noise will disorganize the meeting schedule.
meanings.sent2: The power outage disorganize the entire production line.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to disorganize the perfectly aligned shoes.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in leadership disorganized the team dynamics.
meanings.sent5: The spilled coffee disorganized the color-coded files into a messy jumble.
